warning.title: Do Not Adjust Without Guidance
warning.para: It is not recommended to change these values without the guidance of &productname; developers. Please contact support for assistance.

chapter.para: Nproc is the maximum number of processes allowed per user. In the case of scf, the nproc value applies to the vcap user. In scf, there are parameters, kube.limits.nproc.soft and kube.limits.nproc.hard, to configure a soft nproc limit and a hard nproc limit for processes spawned by the vcap user in scf pods. By default, the soft limit is 1024 while the hard limit is 2048. The soft and hard limits can be changed to suit your workloads. Note that the limits are applied to all pods.
When configuring the nproc limits, take note that:

listitem.para: If the soft limit is set, the hard limit must be set as well.
If the hard limit is set, the soft limit must be set as well.
The soft limit cannot be greater than the hard limit.

sect2.title: New Deployments
sect2.para: For new &productname; deployments, follow the steps below to deploy &productname; with nproc limits configured:

step.para: Pass your uaa secret and certificate to scf:
step.screen:
&prompt.user;SECRET=$(kubectl get pods --namespace uaa \ --output jsonpath='{.items[?(.metadata.name=="uaa-0")].spec.containers[?(.name=="uaa")].env[?(.name=="INTERNAL_CA_CERT")].valueFrom.secretKeyRef.name}')
CA_CERT="$(kubectl get secret $SECRET --namespace uaa \ --output jsonpath="{.data['internal-ca-cert']}" | base64 --decode -)"
